hintAnswer: For the real numbers: division by $$0$$, square root of a negative, log of something less than or equal to $$0$$
title: Definition
text: When is a function undefined at a certain point?
choices: For the real numbers: division by $$0$$, square root of a negative, log of something less than or equal to $$0$$
For the real numbers: division by $$0$$, square root of a negative
For the real numbers: division by $$0$$ only

title: Substitute
text: So, we have that $$sect=\frac{1}{0}$$ at $$t=\frac{\pi}{2}+n \pi$$ for any integer $$n$$, making sect undefined at these points.
